name: Zoetry Agua Punta Cana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is absolutely stunning. When we arrived I expected to see much more guests milling around but soon found out this place is much more intimate and personal feeling compared to many of the other resorts on the island. As soon as we got out of our taxi we were greeted with 2 glasses of delicious ginger ice tea while they took our bags. Everyone and everything at this place is meant to make you feel comfortable, like the whole place was built for your comfort and relaxation. My girlfriend and I really grew to love the feeling of intimacy and almost having a sense of "ownership" of the resort.
reviews.title: Excellence

reviews.text: The grounds of the resort are meticulously manicured and beautiful. The rooms are well thought out and spacious. We had a great private patio that we used when the rain would pass through during some of our days. The pools are wonderful and designed in a way that you can find our own private spot if you'd like. The spa is absolutely stunning with steam rooms, sauna, whirlpools, sensation showers, and quality massage therapists on hand.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: The food is really, really good. Fresh seafood at all times, comfort items like burgers, steaks, and pasta with most of the vegetables and herbs grown in and around the grounds. We definitely took advantage of the 24 hour room service a few times. The drink selection was great with nice high end liquor and a changing selection of delicious custom drinks available each day.
reviews.title: The best vacation ever

reviews.text: You will also have free access to any of the other resorts in the Zoetry family. We went to the more family oriented and much larger Dreams Resort which was down the road a couple of times to play in the casino, hang out in the dance club and stroll around. It's a nice change of pace from Zoetry if you want to spend a night out around a bigger crowd/setting. The greatest part about it is that none of the other guests staying at Dreams, Secrets, etc can come to Zoetry without paying but Zoetry guests can go to all the other resorts free of charge with access to the all-inclusive food and drinks.
reviews.title: The Perfect Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best part of our trip was having the privilege of being served by some of the nicest people my girlfriend and I have ever met. They were there to help with anything at any time with a smile on their face. Hector, Francisco , Eduardo, Dany, Eddy, and many more names that I cannot remember at the moment. Please remember to always tip all the staff members, often and generously. They are working their butts off for you.
reviews.title: Calm Before the Storm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I traveled with my girlfriend to the DR 3-10 Aug 13. Staying at Zoetry was a very pleasant experience. For the most part it was serene (great accomodations, nice pool, good food and dining areas, and a beautiful beach area). Reconizable and courteous staff include Ansy (entertainment coordinator), Sadi (beach and pool beverage attendant), Andre (lobby bar keep), and Manuel "Manny" (water sports).
reviews.title: Relaxation Destination

reviews.text: During our trip I was able to get scuba dive certified by Eugenio "Eugene" Martinez (coordinated through Manny at the water sports hut). Eugene has been a certified dive instructor for nearly 30 years and is a true professional. My girlfriend and I were able to complete five dives during the week. We also did horseback riding on the beach and took a trip to Catalina Island (both were lots of fun).
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
It was "Our Pleasure"!
reviews.text: The first night we were there, the hotel held an open buffet at their best restaurant (Indigo, views of the ocean). They combined the tables in order to meet other couples. Great idea! We met a wonderful couple from France and we will remain friends with them for a lifetime.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative things we experienced included the sounds of construction in the early morning, an occassional miscommunication on food orders, and families with children (overflow from sister hotel (Dreams)). Also, once you arrive in your room, be sure to call the front desk to turn on your hot water and wi-fi.
reviews.title: Absolute Perfection!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ansy, Jean Carlos and Juan Hillario are the best worker at the hotel. The entire staff was great but these three really went above and beyond. I highly recommend this all inclusive hotel. I had a great time and am thinking about returning in December.
reviews.title: Didn't quite live up to expectations :(

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a difficult review to write. I have to agree with a lot of the positives that have been written about this resort and I'm sure that if you come in November when all the construction is over (or so Zoetry promises!) that everything will be wonderful. Our problem was that we chose to visit the place during their off season - the resort was only 1/3 full - and they were capitalizing on the low capacity to get a lot of their maintenance done. The major additions - basically doubling capacity - really didn't affect us at all. This portion of the construction is separated from most of the resort and the impact of it, as has been described by others, was minimal. However, the thatching (cana) that is basically the roof of every building needs to be replaced about every 8 years and it's being replaced on many of the buildings right now. As a result of this, the Indigo restaurant was being entirely gutted and was closed for the entire week we were there; also necessitating the closure of the (adjacent) main pool for three consecutive days because of falling debris. The same work was also being done on the coffee bar; internet cafe and boutique keeping them closed for the week as well. These three shops will probably be completed as I write this and the Indigo Restaurant work was moving quickly - my estimate was that it would be completed by the first week in October (2013). The bottom line on all this from a review standpoint is that it probably won't affect YOU as a future guest at all. But I do think the caveat is that while off season prices may be lower and rooms may be more available, resorts use the time (understandably!) to do their heavy maintenance when there's fewer guests. Problem is, it makes for a less inviting stay. We were placed right next to the construction - supposedly an upgrade, but the workmen were very noisy starting at about 7 AM. Add to this fact the problem that only one of the two other restaurants was open each night made our dining choices very limited. Incidentally, of the two restaurants only Amaya has AC. Olena therefore can be very uncomfortably warm at this time of year and when you have no alternative choice of restaurant...well, we sweated a lot every second night!
reviews.title: Maybe Not In The Off-Season!

reviews.text: OK; enough about the "unfixables"! The place itself is beautiful. Grounds are well kept and as I said, all the thatch is experiencing a makeover - even on the guest rooms and walkways. The pools are very nice but they as well as many of the the walkways could use some resurfacing in the future. Not a big deal though.
reviews.title: Beware the ants and food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would rate the food as "very good" although not the "excellent" some other reviewers have given it. We could have used a bit more variety, but with one of the restaurants out of commission this was probably a big factor. Lunch on the beach was great! Their beef was excellent; something that is pretty unique in the Islands! All the adult beverages are top shelf. My wife and I are martini drinkers and we were able to imbibe our normal Grey Goose and Bombay Sapphire's "No Problem"! Although there is a "for purchase wine" list (rather steep in price), the "included" wines were all pretty good.
reviews.title: Relaxing trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was always enough space under a palapa on the beach or at the pool (when it was open). But as I said, the resort was only 1/3 full and will be doubling its size. I'd have a little concern about beach accommodations in the future since it did not appear that the beach size will be increasing to match the additional guest load and full capacity would make it 6 times as full as we were this week. Towels were plentiful and the chair cushions were replaced when we were there.
reviews.title: The Ultimate Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff here are what set the place a step ahead. They really did know our names by the second day and greeted us as such continually. I probably won't remember all their names, but Merina, Fernando, Juan, Juaquin and Rosalia of the wait staff were all spectacular.
reviews.title: Fantastic - bringing two friends back in October!!
Amazing Gem
reviews.text: My husband and I booked a trip to Zoetry after reading the reviews on here. We were amazingly surprised once we arrived. We have traveled all over the world, yet had never stayed at an All-Inclusive before as we have heard nothing but horror stories from many people. Besides, whenever I would see a Sandals commercial, it would make me feel queasy (Super cheesy is not my idea of a great vacation.) When we arrived at the property, you will notice it is a small property. However, they are in the process of adding on an additional 50 suites which we were told are bigger rooms (which is crazy as our room was quite large enough just for the two of us) I may be mistaken, however I think that they said there was even going to be another pool in that area as well. The fact that it is such a small resort and the amount of limited rooms, made us feel as if we were the only ones on the property at times, which we absolutely loved. The beach and grounds are absolutely BEAUTIFUL! The workers at this resort take great pride in their work and are extremely hard workers and it shows in the grounds and the level of service that you receive. Here are a few tips:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. I had read mixed reviews about the food. Let me just say this. This is an all-inclusive resort. Due to this, my expectations were not to taste James Beard Award winning cuisine. There were a few things that were not that great (dessert on a few occasions and my husband wasn't fond of the mangu that is in the Dominican breakfast) however, let me just pinpoint some of the major highlights. The croissants in the bread basket in the morning were absolutely delicious! For lunch (we had our's served on the beach everyday) the shrimp ceviche is to die for as well as the plantain soup (ordered it everyday) The grilled lobsters at dinner were delicious and my husband thoroughly enjoyed the fried salami at breakfast. We also enjoyed having a cappuccino everyday in the afternoon at the cafe and the cookies there were superb (however, the cappuccino was more of a latte). For cocktails, my favorite was the Tropical Zoetry which was a rum and passion fruit concoction. They will also deliver a bottle of champagne (actually sparkling wine but again not expecting Vueve Clicquot at an all-inclusive) daily, but you have to ask for it. I would sometimes have them deliver it to me at the beach along with some pineapple juice.
reviews.title: Tropical Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. I highly recommend staying on the lower levels if possible. I heard complaints on here about the thatched roof rooms not cooling properly and there being more bugs in the room and after speaking with another couple who was staying in one of those rooms I can see how this is possible. They stated that where the wall and the roof met, there was a gap of about about 4 inches. So, yeah I can imagine how not having cool temps and bugs would be a problem. We booked an Agua Suite and absolutely loved it. We were in room 16 and it was the closest Agua suite to not only the beach, but the larger pool and Indigo restaurant (where breakfast is served) I also highly recommend bringing a blow up raft so use in the serpentine pool. That was a lot of fun to just float on it and drink cocktails. Someone did mention the pool flaking and I did notice that as well, but again wasn't a major issue so not going to pop a vein over it.
reviews.title: Anniversary Trip to Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. Someone had mentioned moldy rooms on here. When we first went in our room it did smell like that. However, I think that this is due to the fact that they turn off the electricity when rooms aren't in use. I think this because the next day the smell dissipated and also the fridge which we thought wasn't working because the water/beer wasn't cold, was cold by the end of our first day. I also don't know if the mildew is a caribbean issue or not as we stayed at The Westin in Grand Cayman before and our room smelled like that too. But, again wasn't an issue after a few hours of the air being on.
reviews.title: No pillow cases, mouldy room, no napkins. Need I say more?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. They say tips are included and I'm sure they are. But, lets get something straight... TIP!!!! These people are very hard workers and while there are plenty of beautiful resorts in DR, this island still suffers from pockets of poverty in many places. Sometimes we would have the same waiter who served us at breakfast at 7 am, serve us dinner the same day at 9 pm and still did it with a smile. Because of this, we tipped for every meal and every time we were brought drinks on the beach because they deserved it. Service was excellent.
reviews.title: Hola Heaven

aka: Zoetry Agua Punta Cana Hotel Punta Cana
description: Limited to just 53 exclusive suites, their hardwood floors, cane-thatched roofs and natural stone accents harmonize with the lush, secluded oceanfront setting. Although a mere 24 miles from the Punta Cana International Airport, the spirit here is far, far removed from the hectic tempo of everyday living.
